page.title: 16SWINLEY PARK, BRACKNELL.
page.content:
The trees in{Swinley Park}are mainly coniferous, the area being a plantation for the Sawmill. Others include oak and silver birch, some more than 500 years old. Near the Sawmill{foresters}regularly fell the smaller, weaker trees, and chop off the lower branches to give the larger trees more room to grow. They use chain saws and wear helmets, visors, ear protection and thick, strong gloves.
Near the Sawmill there used to be {clay pits.} These were supplying brick-works nearby. Two cottages were knocked down in 1978 for the Sawmill to be built. These were on land belonging to Blanes Farm and Blanes Allotment. In the centre of Swinley Park are the{ruins}of a large house with the remains of its garden.
